hanzi-su-wiki:
驕

Значения

Роскошествовать, быть высокомерным

Мнемоника

Чваниться, задирать голову 夭 будто наблюдаешь что-то очень высокое 高 и ездить на дорогих скакунах 馬.

Варианты

骄

heisig_chinese_memo: The arrogant racing horse owner says his horse was an angel sent from God.
Ru_trainchinese: jiāo: (прил) высокомерный, гордый; жестокий, беспощадный (о солнце); избалованный, изнеженный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the lofty (喬) horse (馬) has pride
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The arrogant race horse loves to see his own mirror image.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " horse " and " Qiao ", the original meaning is a six-foot-high horse. "Said Wen": "A horse is six feet tall and proud. From the horse, Qiao Sheng. The "Poetry" says: I, Ma Weijiao. One said: Wild horse.

" Pride " can mean a strong horse. "Poetry‧Weifeng‧Shuoren": "Four males have pride, Zhu Xiu 镳镳." Mao Chuan: "Arrogance, strong appearance."

" Pride " also means exuberant and strong. "Lu Shichunqiu: Your Life": "Many of the world's masters are rich and arrogant."

" Pride " also means that the horse is not controlled and untamed. Tang Wang Changling's "Chengbang Song": "Autumn breeze and mulberry strips, grass white fox and rabbit proud."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " horse " and " Joe ", the original meaning is a six-foot-high horse.
humanum_full_description:
從「馬」，「喬」聲，本義為六尺高的馬。《說文》：「馬高六尺爲驕。从馬，喬聲。《詩》曰：我馬唯驕。一曰：野馬。」

　　「驕」可表示馬壯健。《詩‧衛風‧碩人》：「四牡有驕，朱幩鑣鑣。」毛傳：「驕，壯貌。」

　　「驕」也表示旺盛、強烈。《呂氏春秋‧貴生》：「世之人主多以富貴驕得道之人。」

　　「驕」也指馬不受控制，不馴服。唐王昌齡〈城傍曲〉：「秋風鳴桑條，草白狐兔驕。」
humanum_short_description: 從「馬」，「喬」聲，本義為六尺高的馬。

Kanshudo mnemonic:the lofty (喬) horse (馬) has pride
Chinese: The arrogant racing horse owner says his horse was an angel sent from God.
Meaning: arrogant
Hanzi: 骄
Story: The arrogant race horse loves to see his own mirror image.
Kind: traditional

從「 馬 」，「 喬 」聲，本義為六尺高的馬。《說文》：「馬高六尺爲驕。从馬，喬聲。《詩》曰：我馬唯驕。一曰：野馬。」 「 驕 」可表示馬壯健。《詩‧衛風‧碩人》：「四牡有驕，朱幩鑣鑣。」毛傳：「驕，壯貌。」 「 驕 」也表示旺盛、強烈。《呂氏春秋‧貴生》：「世之人主多以富貴驕得道之人。」 「 驕 」也指馬不受控制，不馴服。唐王昌齡〈城傍曲〉：「秋風鳴桑條，草白狐兔驕。」
From the sound of " horse" and " Qiao", the original meaning is a six-foot-high horse. "Said Wen": "A horse is six feet tall and proud. From the horse, Qiao Sheng. The "Poetry" says: I, Ma Weijiao. One said: Wild horse. " Pride" can mean a strong horse. "Poetry‧Weifeng‧Shuoren": "Four males have pride, Zhu Xiu 镳镳." Mao Chuan: "Arrogance, strong appearance." " Pride" also means exuberant and strong. "Lu Shichunqiu: Your Life": "Many of the world's masters are rich and arrogant." " Pride" also means that the horse is not controlled and untamed. Tang Wang Changling's "Chengbang Song": "Autumn breeze and mulberry strips, grass white fox and rabbit proud."

驕字的基本解释

驕
jiāo
见“骄”。

驕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiāo］
［《廣韻》舉喬切，平宵，見。］
“喬2”的被通假字。“骄1”的繁体字。
(1)六尺高的马。
(2)马壮健貌。
(3)指马不受控制，不驯服。
(4)骄傲；骄纵。
(5)怠慢；轻视。
(6)旺盛；强烈。
(7)通“嬌”。宠爱；娇惯。
(8)通“騷”。骚臭。
(9)通“矯”。参见“驕敬”。
[②]［xiāo］
［《集韻》虚驕切，平宵，曉。］
“骄2”的繁体字。
犬名。参见“歇驕”。
[③]［qiáo］
［《集韻》渠嬌切，平宵，曉。］
“骄3”的繁体字。
人名用字。春秋时陈有袁骄。见《公羊传·僖公四年》“何以不稱使”唐陆德明释文。
[④]［jiāo］
［《集韻》嬌廟切，去笑，見。］
“骄4”的繁体字。
见“驕4驁”。

驕字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【馬字部】　驕； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页1445第25
【唐韻】舉喬切【集韻】【韻會】居妖切，?音嬌。【說文】馬高六尺爲驕。【玉篇】壯貌。　又野馬也。　又馬?逸不受控制也。　又【正字通】恣也，自矜也。【書·周官】位不期驕。【詩·小雅】驕人好好，勞人草草。　又或作喬。【禮·樂記】齊音敖辟喬志。【註】喬音驕。　又【集韻】嬌廟切，音撟。驕驁，馬行貌。又縱恣也。【史記·司馬相如傳】低卬夭蟜据以驕驁兮。【註】椐，直項也。驕驁，縱恣也。驕音居召反。　又【五音集韻】居夭切，音矯。僨驕不可禁之勢。【莊子·在宥篇】僨驕而不可係者，其惟人心乎。【音義】驕如字。又居表反。　又【集韻】虛嬌切【正韻】吁驕切，?音囂。與獢同。短喙犬也。【詩·秦風】載獫歇驕。【釋文】驕，本又作獢。許喬反。　又古通虞韻。【前漢·敘傳】漢興柔遠，與爾剖符。皆恃其岨，乍臣乍驕。

考證：〔【史記·司馬相如傳】夭蟜椐以驕驁兮。〕　謹照原文夭蟜上增低卬二字。椐改据。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiāo］
["Guangyun" cite Qiaoqie, Ping Xiao, see you. ]
"Joe 2" was passed falsely. Traditional characters for "骄1".
(1) A six-foot-tall horse.
(2) The horse is strong and healthy.
(3) Refers to the horse being out of control and untamed.
(4) Pride; arrogant indulgence.
(5) Neglect; contempt.
(6) Vigorous; strong.
(7) Through "Jiao". Spoiled; pampered.
(8) Through "Sao". Stinky.
(9) Through "correction". See "Pride and Respect".
[②]［xiāo］
["Jiyun" is arrogant and cut, flat night, dawn. ]
Traditional characters for "骄2".
Dog name. See "Xiejiao".
[③]［qiáo］
["Ji Yun" Qu Jiao cut, Ping Xiao, Xiao. ]
Traditional characters for "骄3".
Use characters for names. In the Spring and Autumn Period, Chen Youyuan Jiao. See "The Story of Gongyang·The Four Years of Xi Gong" "Why not be an ambassador" Tang Lu Deming's explanation.
[④]［jiāo］
["Ji Yun" Jiaomiao cuts, laugh, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "骄4".
See "Pride 4 Shao".
